titles.title: To amend the Competitiveness Policy Council Act to provide for reauthorization, to rename the Council, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E2047)
Referred to the House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Growth and Credit Formation.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs
House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

action.text: Mr. Kanjorski moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

action.text: Considered under suspension of the rules.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs
House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

committee.name: House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs
House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 8/6/1993--Introduced. Amends the Competitiveness Policy Council Act to rename it and to: (1) change the name of the Competitiveness Policy Council to the National Competitiveness Commission (Commission); and (2) reauthorize and extend the Commission. Amends the National Competitiveness Commission Act (as renamed) to make technical changes with respect to Commission duties, powers, staff, and reporting requirements.
